Create folders by feature, not by file type.

This is the best all advices, and should be applied for other frameworks as well. This talk was about the same advice as well http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WpkDN78P884
Yeah, I also often try to apply it for server-side MVC as well.
First rule on saving time on AngularJs, don't use it unless you must.

That's why I put the disclaimer in there. The question is about using Angular and about large projects. It's not about whether to use Angular, or how to use it from beginning.
Your point is valid though, for a wide range of tools not just angular.
It is less relevant for other tools mainly because of the state of the hype cycle. Right now people are fighting over Ember vs AngularJS as if they should be the default choice.
